posts.author: Rua Blackmist
posts.content:
Heya guys, playing my necromancer was a blast, setting it up myself was slightly interesting. Who would have ever thought... A drow priestess and a bunch of humanoid smitey paladins would ganged up to wreck my day. You know... before turning on each other.

So, by the title you obviously came into possession. 'Monk' that's right a monk. But, not a strength monk that's been running around everywhere, oh no. I thought it might be cool to make a monk, with a Dex build, debating on the Kamas. I thought about an elf due to how they get a dex boost naturally

Anyway, for Arelith lv 30 environment with a 3 level prequisite before changing classes. I thought of something. What could a good Monk DEX build look like? Then, it kinda came to me. The not so original idea and maybe bad one (you guys can correct me if I'm wrong here.) I thought about a

Monk 20/ ShadowDancer 5/ Rogue 5, Elf build (with kamas, someone might have to tell me the advantage of doing kama or fists...)

Why?
Rogue gets hiding/stealth and trap related things, I thought this could help alongside UMD
Unless, giving up all magical scrolls for perma haste +10 discipline, and immunity to paralysis, slows, and movements effects is a good trade off.
Shadowdancer for
  • Their Shadow Evade now lasts 3 rounds per class level.
  • A +1 bonus to Hide is given with each SD level taken.
  • Hide in Plain Sight feat (HiPS) will be granted at SD level 5 instead of 1.
    • After leaving stealth mode, HIPS will have 2 rounds of cooldown before it can be used again. Note that other ways of sneaking, such as corner-sneaking, still work while the cooldown is in effect.
Summon Shadow:
  • Infinite uses/day, but instead has a cooldown of 3 minutes starting the moment the shadow is slain or dismissed.
  • The Shadowdancer gains a d6 of improved sneak attack (feat) per three levels of the Shadow when standing near it.
  • The shadow mirrors the Shadowdancer in several ways:
    • They copy the final physical stats, not the base.
    • They mirror the weapon, but theirs have the "no damage" property, and they cannot use shields or ranged weapons.
    • If the Shadowdancer has the epic shadowlord feat, the shadows copies the names, description, portrait, and soundset of the shadowdancer.
    • They copy Weapon Finesse and all Dual Wield feats, if the shadowdacer has them.
  • Shadows Feats: Blind Fight, Crippling Strike, Sneak Attack (+1d6).
  • Shadows gain the Hide in Plain Sight feat if the master has at least 5 Shadowdancer levels.
  • Shadow Skills: Discipline Hide, Move Silently, Listen, Spot.
  • Shadow Properties: DR 5/+1, 55% Concealment + 1% / Shadowdancer Level, Undead Immunities.
  • Shadows level up to 5 + Shadowdancer Class Level using the Outsider class
  • The Epic Shadow Lord feat grants the Shadow +5% Concealment, +5 Hit Dice
I thought that the HIPS might benefit well as well as shadow evade, etc. But, I have no idea. That's why I came here for help.

If I missed something please let me know

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
Hey man! The problem with this kind of request is that I'm not familiar with Arelith enough to know whether what I can suggest wors the same way as intended there. But, let me try to leave a few comments just to make you think.

If you're taking 20 Monk, I suggest you go for Unarmed attacks. Why? Because the main "cool" aspects of Monk are attained on Monk levels 1-9. A Kama Monk won't need to go past 9 Monk, as you need Improved Evasion for Epic Dodge. Monks gain extra Unarmed damage and movespeed if you take more Monk levels. Other than that, the other stuff you get is pretty unessential. This version would have access to Stunning Fist, so you`d be wise to pump up Wisdom.

If going for a Kama, I recommend more Rogue levels. You may even do a completely different overhaul of that idea by going Monk 6 SD 5 Rogue 19. That would give you IKD from Monk, 4 Bonus Rogue Feats (Improved Evasion, ESF in 2 Hide and Move Silently and maybe Epic Reflexes or Epic Dodge. Defensive Roll you should get from SD 5 (unless that has been changed too). The AB will be the same, saves will be lower, but Sneak Attack damage will be through the roof! If you dual-wield Kamas, that`s 10 attacks per round with huge Sneak Attack buffs to damage!

So, as you see, choosing Kamas or Unarmed doesn`t just impact the weapon choice, powerbuilding-wise, it impacts the whole character level distribution!

Cheers!

posts.author: hunearo
posts.content: It's 10 attacks per round, and one round is six seconds. But you only get it if you are hasted, have ITWF, you are in flurry of blows mode, and you have 16 pre-epic BAB (with this class combo you will never reach 16, so you can get 9 APR at most if Arelith didn't changed something here).

Rua, all builds have inherent strengths and weaknesses and some builds are good against some kinds of enemies and bad against others. This build I suggested would have Sneak Attack as its main source of damage, and would automatically be inherently weak against any Sneak Immune monsters / enemies (Dwarven Defenders and Pale Masters, for example). Dex Monks don't do much damage, unless you go for Cleric / Monk, but that's more Cleric than Monk, so a completely different build in itself. However, you'd be great against heavy-hitting Meleers with HiPS and so much SA damage. You'd most likely fail your KD attempts, but you wouldn't need them coming out of the shadows and catching them flat-footed with 19 Rogue levels. Dex Monks with Hips have really high AC and Epic Dodge, so they can avoid a lot of damage and use sneaky tactics to overwhelm their opponents. And they're probably the best there are at that!

I don't know how much non-sneak damage you would do because I don't know what kind of items are available on the server, but you'd need to rely on UMD scrolls and wands to buff up your weapons. If you have access to Greater Magic Weapon and Flame Weapon wands, that alone will increase your damage output at least threefold. But yeah, you'd be limited to items and buffs to get a higher damage output against the sneak-immune.

There will be others better qualified than I on this, but I do lurve me some Monk, so I feel the need to contribute something!

I've always been predominantly a STR-based "fister" (ugh), but am currently testing out a halfling, D-Wielding, DEX-based kama build (M21/Rog13/CoT6) in a couple of environments (neither being Arelith, alas). The prime difference I've found is that, with the Dexer, it's really not "dodge and hope you don't go splat". Your AC can reach astronomic levels, and what isn't covered directly by AC is handled by ED, Defensive Roll and Imp Evasion, so it becomes more like hitting smoke. Yes, in a toe-to-toe fight, you will be chipping away delicately, but very, very often -and with HiPS or even "normal" stealth skills, Sneak Attack and Crippling Strike are your best friends. And Finesse comes in very handy for KD/IKD for AB against those nasty mages, too. Basically, it's that a DEX monk requires a whole different mind-set from a STR one. And you still have Imp Unarmed Attack anyway, so you can always don the mittens for those requiring bludgeoning.

Don't get me wrong, my preferred style will likely always be to stand there as a bloke in a frock and say, "bring it on", but I'm appreciating the stealthy little bastards more and more as I go on. The statue of David wasn't created by one big thump, but lots of little chips, after all.

EDIT: Bloody hell - double ninja-ed!

OK, Please take into consideration that I made this in 5 minutes, so there might be some oversights in there.

If you want Discipline (I don't think you need it), you'd need to delay that last Monk level to much much later, and IMO your AC will always be higher than your Discipline roll + modifier. Also, there are exactly 62 extra skill points, which means you can have two full skills more than what you actually have. Your choice is to lower INT and take away one of those, but that may make it so that you don't have enough skill points for everything that you need. But if you do keep it as is, I suggest you wait until epic levels to start taking them, because around level 15 you'll have a skill point shortage.

So, a couple more things. I had to delay SD 5 to level 21, because if I had taken it pre-epic, I would lose a point of BAB. Walk around in Stealth, but have a stack of Invisibility potions available, as you'll only have HiPS from level 21 on.

There may be some other things I have overlooked, seeing as I made it in 5 minutes, but it should be a good place to start. Your HP will be sufferable. I originally started with 12 CON, but I had to take it out so I could meet the requirements for Epic Dodge at level 27. The alternative could be going Halfling, but that would cost you a feat, which you simply don't have. Only Human will net you all the feats you need to fill requirements for ITWF and SD. Oh well! Something has to give!

I hope you like it!

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content:
If you change to a non-Human, the feat you lose is at level 1, not level 30. This build needs every one of the pre-epic feats it has.

Whether unarmed or dual kamas are better depends on what magic level is available where you are playing. As a rule of thumb, if the best you can get is +5 or lower, unarmed will definitely give more damage per round because of the d20 damage die, the highest in the game, but if you can get +7 or better, dual kamas will do more damage because of more attacks. Right at +6 is iffy, depending on what other effects are on the weapons.

The way it was explained to me several years ago was that if your Strength is low, your Discipline skill will not be enough to do you any good. Also, they have to hit you with a 5-point penalty to their AB to knock you down, and with good AC plus Epic Dodge, that won't be easy.

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
Rua, Improved Sneak Attack is being taken with a Rogue Bonus feat. You can't drop that one. The feats that you'd have to choose from in terms of dropping are all the pre-epic feats.

Going Elf would mean Experience Penalty, so I'd be more inclined to switch to Halfling, if anything. But then you'd have to drop a VERY IMPORTANT feat:

Dodge - SD requirement, undroppable
Mobility - SD requirement, Undroppable
Weapon Finesse - Impossible to drop for a DEXer
Weapon Focus - Undroppable
TWF/ Ambidexterity/ ITWF - Undroppable if you want this toon to be a surprise sneaker with loads of attacks per round
That leaves Blind Fight, which would make fighting Concealed monsters a NIGHTMARE!

So no, I would not advise you to switch race.
However, that doesn't mean you can't drop Improved Sneak Attack if you don't want it, however, you need to select a feat that is in the Rogue bonus feat list. ESF: Move Silently is a good alternative if you want.

Your AC is 28 naked without gear or buffs, but you can add AC by buffing Wisdom and DEX and also from robes, boots (Monk Boots), plus all other buffs you can get through UMD scrolls and wands. So your AC will always be higher than your Discipline roll. I never take Discipline on my DEXers, and I'm sort of an expert on the subject. I'm famous (or infamous LOL) for many 8-STR Cleric Monks.

Does that make sense?

Lata!
